Laurent Gbagbo has refused to step down as the Ivory Coast's president despite losing a Nov. 28 election according to UN-certified results which showed rival Alassane Ouattara the victor. The eight-country West African Economic and Monetary ( WAEMU) has shut down Gbagbo's access to Ivorian funds held at the Senegal headquarters of the region's central bank, but Gbagbo hit back last week by requisitioning its local Ivorian offices.`` These acts are without precedent in the Union, Jose Mario Vaz, finance minister of Guinea Bissau and current president of the eight-country zone's council said before talks in Dakar.
